jol.net
Class Network

java.lang.Object
  jol.net.Network

public final class Network
extends java.lang.Object

The Network manager class.

The network manager is responsible for the initialization and maintenance of all networking components.

Constructor Summary
Network(Runtime context)
          Create a new network manager.

Constructor Detail

Network

public Network(Runtime context)
Create a new network manager. This will allocate a network buffer table NetworkBuffer and a connection table Connection.

Parameters:
context - The runtime context.
Method Detail

                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          UpdateException
Install network components.

Parameters:
port - The listen port.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
UpdateException

shutdown

public final void shutdown()
Shutdown all network connections.

tuple

public static final Tuple tuple(java.lang.String direction,
                                Address address,
                                Message message)
Method for creating a tuple that can be inserted into the network buffer.

Parameters:
direction - The message direction (send/receive)
address - The message address.
message - The message payload.
Returns:
A tuple filled in with formal values.

buffer

public NetworkBuffer buffer()
Get the network buffer.

Returns:
The network buffer object.

create

public Channel create(java.lang.String protocol,
                      Address address)
Create a new channel. NOTE: Will not register channel with Connection table.

Parameters:
protocol - The channel protocol.
address - The channel address.
Returns:
A new channel object or null on error.

close

public void close(Channel channel)
Close the connection channel and stop its thread. This method will NOT remove the channel from the connection table. That must be done explicitly by either deleting from the #Connection table or calling the Connection.unregister(Channel) method.

Parameters:
channel - Connection channel to be stopped.

connection

public Connection connection()
Get the connection table. The purpose of this method is for the TCP server to register/unregister new connections.

Returns:
The connection table.
